Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, squiddyjc said:
> 
> 
> I actually forgot to say that MechJeb can't get the rendezvous maneuvers down 100%.  I had to restart the autopilot when the burn was about 5.0 m/s off from what was intended.  This is fine until the final velocity matching is needed, since the craft can't come to a standstill.  Of course, there is also the docking autopilot issues, but I did mention that in my previous posts.
> 

So apparently MechJeb for 1.2 isn't out yet? Can you link me which build you're using so I can give it a try?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Naito said:
> 
> 
> So apparently MechJeb for 1.2 isn't out yet? Can you link me which build you're using so I can give it a try?
> 

The one I had been using: [https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/644/](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/644/)

The latest one according to Sarbian's site: [https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/654/](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/654/)

The 1.1.3 version didn't work on 1.2 if I recall correctly.  However, these are still dev builds; the build in the main page on Curse is the 1.1.3 build.

EDIT: I recently switched to the latest build, and while it seems to work slightly better during rendezvous maneuvers, the roll controls are still *very* unstable when performing docking maneuvers.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-22T05:16:09Z" title="11/22/2016 05:16  AM" data-short="7 yr">November 22, 2016</time> by squiddyjc**

So after a long hiatus, I present the Resolution, updated for KSP 1.4!

yes shuttles are out of style now, but I still love them so here's another!

Meticulously rebalanced all around:

- Uses new 1.4 parts for proper size ratios between ET/Shuttle/boosters

- Solved <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> launch oscillation (was due to change in stability algorithms or something, since the control nodes are always offset from the centre of mass it was messing up badly)

- Fully certified for 36T of cargo with zero modifications.  Just load her up and go.

Hope you all enjoy!

![0aXis8Q.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/0aXis8Q.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-04-20T16:44:00Z" title="04/20/2018 04:44  PM" data-short="6 yr">April 20, 2018</time> by Naito**
